intro: Horta, commonly known as leaf lettuce, is a leafy green vegetable belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its crisp, tender leaves that are typically eaten raw in salads or cooked in various dishes. The plant grows in a rosette formation, with broad, dark green leaves that are often harvested before the plant flowers. Horta thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil and consistent moisture. Its cultivation is widespread in temperate regions due to its nutritional value and versatility in culinary use.
